clinical_study.brief_title: A Cross-Sectional Survey to Evaluate Diabetes Management, Control, Complications, Psychosocial Aspects of Patients With Type 2 Diabetes in Sri Lanka
clinical_study.official_title: A Cross-Sectional Survey to Evaluate Diabetes Management, Control, Complications, Psychosocial Aspects of Patients With Type 2 Diabetes in Sri Lanka

brief_summary.textblock: This study is conducted in Asia. The aim of this non-interventional study is to evaluate the current status of diabetes management, control, and complications in diabetic subjects in Sri Lanka.

study_pop.textblock: People having been treated for at least a year are eligible for the study. The selection of the patients will be done randomly by the individual physician involved in the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- People with type 2 diabetes mellitus (DM) who are being treated, with any of the non-pharmacological or pharmacological options, at a particular centre for at least 1 year and who have visited the centre within the last 3-6 months
- Patients willing to sign informed consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous participation in this study
- Unable to comply with protocol requirements
- Confirmed or suspected pregnancy
